description.narrative: By 2017, policies, strategy, guidance and budget of four sectors (WASH, Education, Child Protection, and Health and Nutrition including HIV and AIDS integrate DRR and CCA for disaster risk management with special attention to most at risk children, adolescents, especially girls, and women, which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Health And Emergencies, Nutrition And Emergencies, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Wash And Emergencies. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, national policies, legislation, plans, budgets, coordination and monitoring mechanisms are enabling the survival, development, protection and participation rights of children, adolescents, and women, to be fulfilled with equity in all contexts, including humanitarian situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, policies, strategy, guidance and budget of four sectors (WASH, Education, Child Protection, and Health and Nutritionincluding HIV and AIDS integrate DRR and CCA for disaster risk management with special attention to most at risk children,adolescents, especially girls, and women

description.narrative: UNICEF advocacy resulted in integration of child perspective in National Disaster Risk Reduction Action Plan, New Local Disaster and Climate Risk Management Plan and Local Self Governance Act. DRR guidance note and Climate Change Adaptation strategy note developed to enhance work with the government over the next five years. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: All four sectors (WASH, Education, Child Protection, and Health and Nutrition) have DRR and CCA integrated into annual plans and programmes by 2017

baseline.value: Limited DRR and CCA interventions included in sectoral plans and programmes

target.value: 2017:DRR and CCA mainstreamed in plans and programmes in at least four sectors by 2017

actual.value: 2017:All four sectoral line ministries (WASH, Education, Child Protection, Health and Nutrition) have integrated DRR and CCA into annual plans and programmes including early recovery plan of earthquake-affected and flood -affected districts. DRR and CCA has been considered as cross cutting issues and is

title.narrative: % of sectoral annual budgets allocated and expended on DRR and CCA programme activities

target.value: 2017:WASH (10%), Education (10%), Child Protection (5%), Health (5%) and Nutrition (10%)

actual.value: 2017:This indicator has been constrained since the beginning of this country programme. Difficult to get information and no clarity on denominator.
